title: 113_s2245
content: The Act may be cited as the "District of Columbia Paperwork Reduction Act" and eliminates congressional review of newly passed District laws. The District of Columbia Paperwork Reduction Act eliminates congressional review of newly passed District laws by amending specific sections and rules. The District of Columbia Paperwork Reduction Act eliminates congressional review of newly passed District laws by amending specific sections and rules, including conforming amendments to the District of Columbia Home Rule Act. This includes recognizing the constitutional right of each House to change rules relating to that House. Section 404(e) is amended by removing references to section 602(c). Section 462 is amended by removing subsections (b) and (c). Section 472(d) is amended regarding payments not subject to appropriation. Section 475(e) is also amended. Section 472(d) is amended to exclude certain payments from requiring appropriation. Amendments are made to sections related to initiative and referendum in the District Charter. Section 16 of the District of Columbia Election Code of 1955 is amended to remove certain sections and sentences related to custodianship and holding of acts. Section 16 of the District of Columbia Election Code of 1955 is amended to remove certain sections and sentences related to custodianship and holding of acts, replacing them with the term "section." The amendments made by this Act apply to acts of the District of Columbia passed by the Council and signed by the Mayor, vetoed and repassed, allowed to become effective without the Mayor's signature, or ratified by a majority of voters on or after October 1, 2014.
